qas.question: Which piece of legislation quickly followed President Kennedy's assassination?
Outside of the private business regulations, what was the other aim of the Civil Rights Act?
Which other Executive Order did the Civil Right's Act work closely with?
What was the purpose of Title VII of the Civil Rights Act?

answers.text: to end discrimination in all firms with 25 or more employees

qas.question: What was the goal of the Equal Employment Opportunity C omission?

answers.text: ending discrimination in the nation's workplace

qas.question: Which piece of legislation quickly followed Vice-President Kennedy's assassination?
Outside of the private business regulations, what was the other aim of the Non-Civil Rights Act?
Which other Executive Order did the Civil Right's Act not work closely with?
What was the purpose of Title VII of the Non-Civil Rights Act?

context: This eventually led to LBJ's <a0_0><b5_0>Civil Rights Act<b5_0/><a0_0/>, which came shortly after President Kennedy's assassination. This document was more holistic than any President Kennedy had offered, and therefore more controversial. It aimed not only to <a1_0><b6_0>integrate public facilities<b6_0/><a1_0/>, but also private businesses that sold to the public, such as motels, restaurants, theaters, and gas stations. Public schools, hospitals, libraries, parks, among other things, were included in the bill as well. It also worked with JFK's executive order <a2_0><b7_0>11114<b7_0/><a2_0/> by prohibiting discrimination in the awarding of federal contracts and holding the authority of the government to deny contracts to businesses who discriminate. Maybe most significant of all, Title VII of the Civil Rights Act aimed <a3_0>to <b8_0>end discrimination<b8_0/> in all firms with 25 or more employees<a3_0/>. Another provision established the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission as the agency charged with <a4_0>ending discrimination in the nation's workplace<a4_0/>.:74
